Ask HN: Why is running OpenMPI inside Docker getting sporadiously slow?
text:
I am looking at a legacy code here which is first creating a docker container with cgroups (already disabled this, same behavior), which then run MPI jobs inside the docker container. It's fast 70% of the time, but sometimes MPI_AllReduce etc. are really getting slow, 2x up to 10x slower performance hit. Please do not tell me it's a bad idea for using docker/k8s for HPC/MPI, trust me, I know that... :) Still, I would really like to understand why docker seems to interfere from time to time here and is killing the performance.

Thanks in advance to all techies out there which might bring me on the right track.
